subject: RE: [EVP-ITC] sonia background noise
author: Frank Sumption
full_text:
That's essentially what my random radio method produces, that kind of bable 
when it's functioning properly, cuz you get all the stations, and noise in 
between stations, and distant statiosn that fade in and out, then out of 
that will emerge the voices. At least there's some other's work that tends 
to back up mine.

Frank


>From: LON3_S7AR <lon3_s7ar@...>
>Reply-To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
>To: evp-itc@yahoogroups.com
>Subject: [EVP-ITC] sonia background noise
>Date: Fri, 23 Feb 2007 07:49:39 -0800 (PST)
>
>    im sure youve got this, but just incase
>
>http://aaevp.com/resources/resources2.htmBackground    Sound
>          Portuguese    Language Crowd Babble
>          In the search for an effective    background sound source, crowd 
>babble has proven to be one of the more    effective. Brazilian ITC 
>researcher, Sonia Rinaldi, made this Portuguese    language crowd babble 
>sound track available to the AA-EVP. We have    reversed it and clipped any 
>outstanding vocalization so that just a    steady flow of voice frequency 
>sound is heard. It is only 30 seconds, so    you will want to either copy 
>and paste several times to make the file    longer or play it in a loop.   
>Download this    mp3 file here.
>
>
>Amy Sutter
>
>www.myspace.com/LON3_S7AR
